MOOC UPDATE The third offering of my Introduction to Databases MOOC launched on January 7, 2014.

MOOC UPDATE

 The third offering of my Introduction to Databases MOOC launched on January 7, 2014.

LayoutNode.Content: Introduction to Databases Coursera Class2Go platform OpenEdX
LayoutNode.SRC: Introduction to Databases Coursera Class2Go platform OpenEdX

LayoutNode.Content: All materials from all of the offerings -- lectures with in-video quizzes, multiple-choice quiz assignments, automatically-checked interactive programming exercises, midterm and final exams, optional additional exercises with solutions, and pointers to readings and resources -- are available indefinitely in self-study mode on Coursera here, and will remain hosted on OpenEdX as well once the current course completes.

LayoutNode.Content: [Spring 2011] I'm creating a freely-available online version of my Introduction to Databases course. See more details at the top of this page.
LayoutNode.SRC: • [Spring 2011]   I'm creating a freely-available online version of my Introduction to Databases course. See more details at the top of this page.

LayoutNode.Content: [Spring 2008] Following the spirit of the times, students in our research group launched a blog, aptly named the InfoBlog. Even faculty are getting in on the act: I posted a discussion and summary of my SIGMOD 2007 Research Principles Revealed talk. (Unfortunately the InfoBlog went dormant in early 2009.)
LayoutNode.SRC: • [Spring 2008]   Following the spirit of the times, students in our research group launched a blog, aptly named the InfoBlog. Even faculty are getting in on the act: I posted a discussion and summary of my SIGMOD 2007 Research Principles Revealed talk. (Unfortunately the InfoBlog went dormant in early 2009.)

LayoutNode.Content: [Fall 2006] In an interview in SIGMOD Record -- choose the video or the article (pdf) -- I "speak out on luck, what constitutes success, when to get out of an area, the importance of choosing the right husband, outlandish vacations, how hard it is to be an assistant professor, and more".

Jennifer is married to Alex Aiken. They have two teenage chidren, Tim and Emily. Here are Tim and Emily more than 15 years ago, enjoying some light reading. Nowadays Tim is into photography and maintains his own photo site.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Jennifer is married to Alex Aiken. They have two teenage chidren, Tim and Emily. Here are Tim and Emily more than 15 years ago, enjoying some light reading. Nowadays Tim is into photography and maintains his own photo site.

LayoutNode.Content: Worldwide adventure travel is a major hobby for our family:
LayoutNode.SRC: Worldwide adventure travel is a major hobby for our family:

LayoutNode.Content: Here's a log with selected photos from our travels, a list of off-the-beaten-path travel favorites, and a travel quote I really like.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Here's a log with selected photos from our travels, a list of off-the-beaten-path travel favorites, and a travel quote I really like.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2007-08 we took a Year Off for Travel. I wrote a set of "travelogs" as we went.
LayoutNode.SRC: • In 2007-08 we took a Year Off for Travel. I wrote a set of "travelogs" as we went.

LayoutNode.Content: Long ago I wrote an essay on Adventure Travel with Children Under Four. It evolved into an article about our family travels by Alice Cary that appeared in the Great Outdoor Recreation Pages online magazine (www.gorp.com). Subsequently I wrote two addenda to the original essay: Adventure Travel with Children Ages 4-6, and Bareboat Cruising with Young Children. Except for the Year Off Travelogs, my essays haven't kept pace with the ages and travel activities of my children.
